title.english: So I'm a Spider, So What?

description:
I, the protagonist, was just an ordinary high school girl, but suddenly I was reincarnated as a spider monster in a fantasy world. Not only that, but I awakened in a dungeon filled with vicious monsters. Armed with only my human knowledge and my overwhelming positivity, I'm forced to use spiderwebs and traps to defeat far stronger monsters just to stay alive... So begins the labyrinth survival story of a girl with incredible mental strength living as one of the lowest-ranked beasts!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: حسنا أنا عنكبوت، ماذا في ذلك؟
แมงมุมแล้วไง ข้องใจเหรอคะ

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Football
tags.description: Centers around the sport of football (known in the USA as "soccer").

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

**Ryou Hirata** is a Japanese animator and designer, who does prop, character and art design.
[Twitter](https://x.com/Chappy_Katayama)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakzo2010)

Takashi Sakurai is an animation producer and editor. Takashi Sakurai made his debut in the anime industry in 2003, at Tokyo Kids. He originally was one of the supporting editors at Tokyo Kids, and was later promoted as the general animation editor at the studio. Prior to working for the anime industry, he worked in the live-action industry, and did some CG work at production company Future Pirates. After working on Magikano, he left Tokyo Kids, and joined Anime International Company (AIC), as one of their in-house editors. Due to Sakurai joining the studio, AIC also began offering its editing services to other studios, such as TNK, for School Days. In 2010, he made his animation producer debut with Shukufuku no Campanella, due to it streamlining the production process at AIC. In 2014 he left AIC, and founded his own production company Typhoon Graphics Co., Ltd, otherwise known as Typhoon Graphics, in which its main services are: color design, color design inspection, finish animation, special effects, 2D design, photography, and editing work. 

He also has a good relationship with anime director Seiji Kishi, and after the success of 2006's co-production by GONZO and AIC's  "Seto no Hanayome", Kishi often started directing anime produced at AIC, such as: "Astro Fighter Sunred", "Persona 4: The Animation", and "Jinrui wa Suitai Shimashita".

__Alma mater:__ Tokyo Designer Gakuin College (Animation Department)

Freelance animator and anime director. Married to Naoko Shiraishi, ex-Shaft/Gainax producer and founder of the animation studio Millepensee. He has a [weekly column](http://animestyle.jp/column/battari/) at Anime Style.
Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/).

__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:** 
- [Lumine](https://anilist.co/character/209682/Ying) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Gwen Stacy - Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (Movie); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Movie)
- Renne Bright - Eiyuu Densetsu: Sen no Kiseki IV (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Hajimari no Kiseki (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Kuro no Kiseki (VG)
- Yurusen - Kamen Rider Ghost (VG)
- Fiona - Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (VG)
- Rita Rossweisse - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Moddey - Memento Mori (VG)
- Futaba Sakura - Persona 5/Royal (VG)
- Pascal - NieR: Automata (VG) (VG)
- Nian - Arknights (VG)
- Istina - Arknights (VG)
- Ravi & Apocalyptic Ravi - Epic 7 (VG)
- Schneider - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Lysithea - Fire Emblem: Three Houses (VG)
- Cinderella - Nikke: Goddess of Victory (VG)
- Sugar - Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery (VG)

[Website](http://konomi-suzuki.net/) | [Old Blog](http://ameblo.jp/galapa-konomi) | [New Blog](http://ameblo.jp/konomi-suzuki/)

Konomi Suzuki is a Japanese singer from Osaka Prefecture who is signed to Amuleto. After winning the Animax All-Japan Anisong Grand Prix in 2011, she made her debut in 2012 with the release of her first single "Choir Jail", which peaked at 34 on the Oricon charts; the title track of which was used as the opening theme to the anime television series Dusk Maiden of Amnesia. She released her first album 17, in 2014, two albums in 2015, and a further album Lead, in 2016.

Suzuki cites the character Sheryl Nome from Macross Frontier as her inspiration for making music for anime. Her music has been featured in anime series such as The Pet Girl of Sakurasou, No Matter How I Look at It, It's You Guys' Fault I'm Not Popular!, No Game No Life, and Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World. She has also performed in events in Japan such as Animelo Summer Live and Animax Musix, and at international events in China, Germany, the United States, and Southeast Asia. In 2018, Suzuki made her voice acting debut, playing the role of Rin in the anime television series Lost Song.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jorgongr)
